Articles.Content:
I may have built the largest replica in KSP history here . Using completely stock parts welded together and then scaled up to 4100% of their original size, It's so large that it's clearly visible at 2.5 kilometers. The ship isn't very detailed and has no interior whatsoever but it is fun to grab an RCS equipped spaceplane and fly around the cradle and tram tracks.

'In' the hanger:

On the runway.

In space (the little flashes on the side are mainsails being used to turn the craft upright)

Video:

Previous replica: Boeing 747 with shuttle

Next replica: HMS Warrior 1860

Holy crap! How on Kerbin did you pull that off?

It's too bad there's not a way to disable the part highlighting when hovering over it with the cursor. It takes away from the cinematics of it all.
When the plane was near the tram tracks the highlighting thing actually helped, if it weren't there then it would have been hard to see the girder.
A little more info for you folks, she weighs 19,694,830 tons, could be made bigger and heavier (I could make her 6000% of her original size), before I made her bigger she weighed 440ish tons.
How many friggin Mainsails do you need to move that thing?

They can't, nothing can move this ship, it's more of a space station actually:D

@Caracar, I only used it to make the ship the correct size, without it the ship still weighs about 440 tons.

Edited September 3, 2014 by Megalodon 720
